channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Potholes, 14th February
item.description:
At least three large potholes down Fairhaven Avenue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 68 Boverton Drive, Brockworth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Earth dropped on pavement and road, 14th February
item.description:
Earth is being dropped on the road and pavement, from the current development. No attempt has been made to clean it up. In addition to the vehicles regularly being parked on the pavement (van, earth moving lorries, developers), this is regularly obstructing the pavement, particularly for some members of the community.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Two Gables Hailes Street, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fairhaven Avenue needs re painting, 14th February
item.description:
The Fairhaven Avenue street sign needs re painting as it is extremely difficult for people to read
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 21 Fairhaven Avenue, Brockworth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large bag of rubbish by bench after parish council litter pick, 13th February
item.description:
I organised a parish council litter pick. We have put all other bags into the large waste bin at swindon village hall. This needs emptying. There is 1 remaining bag at the memorial bench on manor road green area, with rubbish removed from the watercourse that I was not able to put in the village Hall bin. Please arrange for this to be collected by Ubico.. In addition, there is fly tipping behind the electricity substation on the other side of manor road and also at the entrance to dog bark lane. Please have the same team remove this. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Manor Road, Swindon Village
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes, 12th February
item.description:
Multiple potholes on beeches close. Dangerous to cyclists
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 6 Birch Close, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Speeding cars, 10th February
item.description:
Typhoon Way is becoming a speedway for boy racers. Won't be long before there's a serious accident. Lived here 13 years, never see any police presence here.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 27 Typhoon Way, Abbeymead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Discarded Dog Poo Bags by Dog Walkers, 10th February
item.description:
The location is Ham Lane Charlton Kings. The area is now walked by a relatively high number of Dog Walkers. It seems that while they are picking up their dogss poo - they are then throwing the bags in the hedges and on the verges. The location of this particualr pile is on the right hand side going down Ham Lane and opposite the Telephone pool that is on the edge of the car park area. Please can this mess be cleared up. Other examples have already been picked up by residents.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cornerstone Ham Lane, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two Road closure signs have been left behind after works completed, 10th February
item.description:
Two Road closure signs left behind. One is at junction of Princes Street and Carlton Road. Other propped up on the house wall at junction of Princes Street and Leighton Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 60 Carlton Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large amount of litter, 9th February
item.description:
A really horrible amount of litter has gathered on the curve of this road as you turn onto the motorway - please could it be cleaned up, thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A417, Hucclecote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A seat and some bin bags dumped, 9th February
item.description:
Hard to tell if this is the right curve in the road, but someone has dumped a red velvet seat and some bin bags here
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Grange Salterley Grange, Leckhampton Hill
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Queens Road - railway station brick boundary wall, 9th February
item.description:
Multiple pieces of graffiti, on outer face of station boundary wall, facing onto Queens Road. Full length of wall, from the station car park exit along past the new-ish steps, through to the corner where wall was rebuilt last year. ALL graffiti on the Queens Road side of the wall needs cleaning off. Not a great advert for Cheltenham as people leave the station.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 77 Queen's Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very deep pothole on the carriageways, 9th February
item.description:
There is a large and deep pothole on the carriageway past the turning for Star Centre towards Crickley Hill
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Greenway Lane, Ullenwood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Stree lighting not working, 8th February
item.description:
The street light never worked from day one
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 5 Olivine Crescent, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown and broken fences, 8th February
item.description:
This area of pathway leading onto the railway bridge requires maintenance to both the fence and foliage. The pathway is restricted to single file and dangerous as pedestrian passing requires stepping into the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Pagets Road, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement, 8th February
item.description:
Pavement covered with soil, leaves and brambles. This has been reported previously. I’ve since received an email say it has been dealt with. It obviously has not. Any cursory inspection of the “verge” beside the road will show where it has been partially cleared.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Dog Lane, Witcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Surface deteriorated around Manhole on Kipling Road, 8th February
item.description:
Can somebody please inspect it

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 59 Kipling Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road is slippery with oil or diesel, 7th February
item.description:
Numerous complains that this section of road (opposite David Lloyd Gym) is slippery with numerous cars skidding and facing opposite direction.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Stadco Takao Europe Ltd Delta Way, Brockworth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter, 7th February
item.description:
Both roadside verges of Hyde Lane from its junction with Church Road to the Cheltenham boundary at Hyde Brook are heavily littered and have not had a litter pick since 2021. This is a primary route for traffic during Gold Cup Week. As it stands an appalling advertisement for Cheltenham.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Hyde Lane, Swindon Village
Report on FixMyStreet
